poem:
Title: Irony Carved in Winter's Heart

Scissorhands, sheared snowflakes aloft at Sadler's Wells,
A Christmas mockery in cold steel whimsy.
Difference cradled in stark puppet's palms,
An icy hymn, bleeding acceptance's warmth.
Carved from celluloid dreams, etched in pain,
Thompson's vision blooms within Bourne's icy reign.
How tenderly oddity dances on stage,
Life's irony clad in a Burtonesque cage.
